definition: to give right of way to another vehicle
mistake/wrong/bad/interlocking/complex/to grind/to polish/to alternate/to stagger/to miss/to let slip/to evade/to inlay with gold or silver
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

sentences.english: Oh, sorry, you are on the wrong bus.
In the beginning we thought that on the wrong car, and like clockwork, like the heart of the tension.
sentences.chinese: 一开始我们以为上错车了，心像发条一样绷紧了。

sentences.english: I'm afraid you've got the wrong bus.
I think we got on the wrong bus.
Constantly checking your watch is perhaps the number one sign you're on the wrong bus.
sentences.chinese: 不断地看表也许是最能说明上错车的迹象。

sentences.english: Our bumpers just grazed (ie touched each other)as we passed.
sentences.chinese: 我们错车时保险杠互相蹭了一下。

sentences.english: I see another network seems to be a ride sidetracks turnouts .
sentences.chinese: 一见网似乎又一次搭错车了。

sentences.english: If you make a mistake, there is no turning back.
sentences.chinese: 如果你搭错车，就无法回头。

sentences.english: After almost 40 minutes I feared the worst.
sentences.chinese: 但过了40分钟的车程，我恐怕是我乘错车了。

sentences.english: It's likely that Tom has taken the wrong bus, or he would be here by now.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆很有可能乘错车了，否则他应该到了。

sentences.english: If I hadn't taken the wrong bus , I wouldn't have missed the contest.
sentences.chinese: 如果我没有乘错车，我就不会不参加竞赛了。

definition: (of two vehicles traveling in opposite directions) to pass by each other
to tailgate/to hit the car in front as a result of tailgating
to pull up (stop one's vehicle)/to park/(of a machine) to stop working/to stall
to get off or out of (a bus, train, car etc)
traffic jam/(of traffic) to get congested
to drive a vehicle/movement of vehicles
highway/expressway/same as 高速公路[gao1 su4 gong1 lu4]
